titles.title: TEST KIDS Act
Thorough Evaluation of State Testing to Kick-start Investigations before Damage is Suffered Act
A bill to require States to report elevated blood lead levels to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
TEST KIDS Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary:
Thorough Evaluation of State Testing to Kick-start Investigations before Damage is Suffered Act or the TEST KIDS Act
This bill requires the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to direct states to report the number of residents under two years old who have elevated blood lead levels.
The CDC must identify areas where children with high blood lead levels are concentrated and investigate the sources of lead in those areas.
